definitions.definition: The decision or judgement of a jury or court; a verdict.
definitions.example: The court returned a sentence of guilt in the first charge, but innocence in the second.

definitions.definition: The judicial order for a punishment to be imposed on a person convicted of a crime.
definitions.example: The judge declared a sentence of death by hanging for the infamous cattle rustler.

definitions.definition: A punishment imposed on a person convicted of a crime.
A saying, especially from a great person; a maxim, an apophthegm.

(grammar) A grammatically complete series of words consisting of a subject and predicate, even if one or the other is implied, and typically beginning with a capital letter and ending with a full stop.
definitions.example: The children were made to construct sentences consisting of nouns and verbs from the list on the chalkboard.

definitions.definition: A formula with no free variables.
Any of the set of strings that can be generated by a given formal grammar.
A pronounced opinion or judgment on a given question.
To declare a sentence on a convicted person; to doom; to condemn to punishment.
definitions.example: The judge sentenced the embezzler to ten years in prison, along with a hefty fine.

definitions.definition: To decree or announce as a sentence.
